artist: Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec; Published by Pierrefort, Paris
creditline: Purchase through Art Quest 2003 and The William Hood Dunwoody Fund
description: two red-brown horses in full gallop, seen from back PR side; foreground horse ridden by figure in tan pants, white shirt and black hat; horse at L ridden by figure in tan pants, pink shirt and red hat; windmill at R
marks: Signature and date LRC, printed backwards in the plate, in black ink:
medium: Color lithograph on Chine volant paper
provenance: (Armstrong Fine Art, Chicago); sold to MIA, 2003.
text: As a young artist, Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec enjoyed depicting outdoor scenes, especially those with horses. Later in life, he frequented the racetrack at Longchamp in the Bois de Boulogne, identified here by the windmill in the background. In the spring of 1899 during a three-month stay in a psychiatric clinic, he started work on a series of lithographs with a racing theme. This lithograph was the only one published before his premature death. It captures the power and energy of the horses as they speed toward the finish line.
title: Le Jockey
